abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental review sets the
            framework to disseminate key screening criteria to the
            energy management companies (EMCs) applying for support from
            the project, to follow environmental guidelines when
            discussing potential renovations. In its review, the EMCs
            should assess the current environmental status of the
            potential subproject, the original pollutant emission, and
            estimated status of the subproject from the processes
            concerned, the types of pollution, or negative environmental
            impacts possibly caused by the subproject, and the types of
            processes and product output of the subproject enterprise,
            to then complete an environmental review checklist, for
            subsequent subproject processing. Potential adverse impacts
            identified will follow mitigation measures, where EMCs
            assume legal responsibilities to ensure environmental
            compliance. The project will not finance subprojects in
            direct violation of environmental policies; specifically the
            following will not be financed: asbestos manufacturing;
            nuclear energy related products; manufacturing of
            ozone-depleting substances, or persistent organic
            pollutants; toxic wastes, insecticides, nor tobacco
            production. Mitigation includes the following technical
            measures: for industrial boilers: layer-by-layer coal
            feeding devices, with pulverizing coal injections to form a
            floating combustion, with appropriate arch shapes, or,
            transform combustion boilers into CFB. Steam pipes: condense
            water recovery, and avoid loss of steam trap leakage, but
            include pipeline heat insulation. Motor driving systems:
            adjust frequency conversion technology, and frequency
            converter. Lighting and power distribution: upgrade
            distribution voltage, shorten distance of power supply, and
            upgrade transformers. Control systems: change manual-control
            into automatic control, with attention to controlling
            increased energy consumption, and nitrous oxide compounds.
            Industrial kiln, and furnaces: use heat insulation of
            furnace body, replacing small furnace and kiln with large,
            more advanced technology. Combustion systems: use new energy
            saving burner.
